revised_title: Doppler Broadening Effects on Transient Excitation of Atomic and Molecular Energy Levels by Monochromatic Laser Radiation
tldr: The author investigates the transient excitation of atomic and molecular energy levels by monochromatic laser radiation, focusing on the effect of Doppler broadening when phase-destroying collisions are dominant. They provide approximate analytical solutions and numerical calculations to understand the impact of Doppler broadening on the population of excited states. This study extends previous research on the topic, considering a wider range of parameters and conditions.
